title: Artificial Intelligence: Revolutionizing Every Aspect of Life - Controversy Brews Over U.S. AI Chip Sales to China
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is rapidly redefining the way we live, work, and interact. No longer confined to the realm of science fiction, AI is now a driving force behind innovations across all sectors— from healthcare and finance to entertainment and manufacturing. Its impact is far-reaching, transforming industries, reshaping economies, and influencing the way we navigate daily life.

title: How an IIT Kanpur alumnus is using real-time AI systems to fix India's vehicle repair ecosystem
description: Vehicle breakdowns in India often cause confusion and delay. Lakshya Khurana's startup, Ride N Repair, is changing this. The company uses artificial intelligence to coordinate repairs in real-time. This system-driven platform aims to bring predictability and transparency to a sector that has long lacked structure. Ride N Repair connects customers, mechanics, and operations through a single intelligence layer.
content:

title: AI video circulated to tarnish my image: Bhagwant Mann to Akal Takht
description: Mann said the video in question was fabricated using artificial intelligence and was deliberately circulated to damage his image and mislead the Sikh community. He added that a false perception was being spread on social media suggesting that he was challenging the authority of the Akal Takht, which he strongly denied.
content: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday alleged that his political opponents circulated an AI-generated fake video to defame him and create controversy around Sikh traditions, a claim he presented before the Akal Takht secretariat while submi... [1674 chars]

title: From Interface to Infrastructure: How Yifei Wang Is Designing Human-Centered AI for the Physical World
description: In an era where artificial intelligence increasingly shapes how people move, pay, and interact with cities, the role of product design is quietly expanding beyond screens. Few practitioners embody this shift as clearly as Yifei Wang—a product designer whose work sits at the intersection of AI, public infrastructure, and human-centered systems thinking.
